title.narrative: OPT 4.2. RISK INFORMED PROGRAMING TO PROTECT CHILDREN FROM THE IMPACT OF NATURAL

description.narrative: National and subnational capacities in selected departments are strengthened in risk informed programing to protect children and adolescents, especially the most vulnerable, from the impact of natural disasters and climate change., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Disaster Risk Reduction. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children, especially the most disadvantaged, including those affected by climate change, are prioritized within the national development agenda.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and subnational capacities in selected departments are strengthened in risk informed programing to protect children andadolescents, especially the most vulnerable, from the impact of natural disasters and climate change.

description.narrative: Bolivian children and youth have officially participated in national decision-making processes and contributed to global declarations linked to the UN Climate Change Conference of Youth 16 (COY16), the 26th UN Climate Change Conference of the Parties (COP26) and YouthForClimate. UNICEF Bolivia&39;s work with children and youth to strengthen climate action was directly incorporated into the country’s main policy instruments: The Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs), Plurinational Climate Change Policy and National Strategy for Climate Empowerment. Finally, UNICEF helped the Ministry of Environment and Water, the Plurinational Authority of Mother Earth and subnational governments develop/monitor child-focused climate change and risk management plans/policies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/12/2021
